[Portrait]Tavernmaster[Dialog]
Good day to you. Might I interest you in a
drink?{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
Mayhap you might. Have you any milk?{END}

[Portrait]Tavernmaster[Dialog]
Ha! I like you already! I've not had a customer
order milk before.
You've seen your share of battle, have you
not? Most men as live that sort of life come
wanting spirits.{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
You mean to say the stories were true?
There are monsters in Gollund?{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
Hordes of them, causing all sorts of trouble.
They had to close the mines.{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
Times as these, knights are too busy slaying
each other to deal with beasts.{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
The town's raised a call for hunters.{END}

[Portrait]Tavernmaster[Dialog]
You can swing a sword, aye?
There's coin to be had in this.{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
I care not for coin. I would go to aid
the people in their plight.{END}

[Portrait]Tavernmaster[Dialog]
A man of honor, are we? Few enough of
those these days.
If only Lord Barbaneth were still alive!
He'd do something about it.{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
As I was meaning to say, though, there's
one among 'em no hunter can best.{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
A keen one, eh? What manner of beast?{END}

[Portrait]Tavern Patron[Dialog]
A beast of legend-the Holy Dragon.{END}

[Portrait]Tavernmaster[Dialog]
You mean to go?{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
Yes-at least to know if the talk is true.{END}

[Portrait]Tavernmaster[Dialog]
Gods be with you, then.{END}

[Portrait]Swordsman[Dialog]
If you leave for the mines of Gollund, would
you not hire my sword to accompany you?{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
I do not believe we've made acquaintance.{END}

[Portrait]Swordsman[Dialog]
I am Beowulf-a hunter.

I pursue the Holy Dragon of which they speak.
It has been my purpose for many a year.

My knowledge of her would surely be a boon.
What say you?{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
[lista]1. I've no need of hired steel.
2. How much gil does your blade require?[finelista][chiudi][Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
My apologies, but I've no need of hired steel.{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
I see. Most unfortunate. Good-bye, then-and
fare-well.{END}

[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
Very well. How much gil does your blade
require?{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
We can speak of coin when the job is done.
Come, let us make for Gollund.{END}
